1.1.3 Middleware

Overview

Middleware is software that provides common services and capabilities to applications outside of what's offered by the operating system. It facilitates communication and data management between different applications and systems.

Types of Middleware

  • Message-Oriented Middleware (MOM): Facilitates asynchronous communication between distributed systems.
  • Remote Procedure Call (RPC) Middleware: Allows programs to execute procedures on other systems.
  • Database Middleware: Enables direct access to databases.
  • API Middleware: Manages and controls APIs.

Use Cases

  • Enterprise Application Integration (EAI): Connecting different enterprise systems.
  • Cloud Integration: Connecting cloud-based applications and services.
  • Data Integration: Consolidating data from various sources.
